issue.title: Bloomberg.com blank page
issue.body:
### Please answer the following questions for yourself before submitting an issue.

- [ ] I am running the latest version
- [ ] I checked the documentation and found no answer
- [ ] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed

### AdGuard version

Adguard 4.0 Nightly 71

### Environment

```markdown
- OS:Android 13
- Device: Samsung
- Firmware:
```


### Root access

- [ ] Yes, I have it.

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, AdGuard Chinese filter, AdGuard Russian filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Social Media filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, EasyPrivacy, Fanboy's Annoyances, Fanboy's Social Blocking List, Peter Lowe's Blocklist, Online Malicious URL Blocklist, Fanboy's Enhanced Tracking List, I don't care about cookies, EasyList Cookie List, NoCoin Filter List, Dandelion Sprout's Annoyances List, Legitimate URL Shortener

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

Hide your search queries, Send Do-Not-Track signals, Strip URLs of tracking parameters, Self-destruction of third-party cookies, Disable WebRTC, Block Push API, Block Location API, Hide your Referrer from third-parties, Hide your User Agent, Hide your IP address, Remove X-client-Data header from HTTP request, Protect from DPI

### Issue Details

Steps to reproduce:
1.open Samsung internet browser or Chrome browser on phone
2. Go to bloomberg.com
3.shows black screen


### Expected Behavior

_No response_

### Actual Behavior

Blank screen

### Screenshots

<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>


### Additional Information

![Screenshot_20230322_175958_Samsung Internet](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/96619913/227059212-8d2cf78c-417c-4ee1-b3c3-783aec93471f.jpg)

comment.body:
Even 2 months to uknown of years (For example, the site will update the code faster).

In addition, Fanboy Annoyances has a built-in "EasyList Cookies" list (that is, the cookie list can no longer be enabled).

On the plus side, it will prove that the cookie/gdpr/ccpa cutout rule is flawed in uBlock Origin and AdBlock/ABP (Then practically every content blocker is susceptible.).

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.walmart.com/account/login](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.walmart.com%2Faccount%2Flogin) ### Comment Username: @misc-activities > In the Walmart login page (see 0.png), I entered my email address and clicked on the Continue button. It opened a message box trying to show me a "Press and Hold" type CAPTCHA but the CAPTCHA didn't load. This can be seen in 1.png. So, I clicked on "Try a different method" in the message box. When I did that, it showed me a picture identification type CAPTCHA (see 2.png). When I completed the CAPTCHA verification, instead of asking me for the password, it went back to the page where it was asking for my email address and showed a message saying, "Something went wrong, please try again." This can be seen in 3.png. > > I closed the AdGuard app and tried and I was able to login successfully. I also tried with Stealth Mode disabled but that didn't work. > > I'm having this issue in Safari as well. ### Screenshots

issue.body:
New type of YouTube ads is blocked by our filters. If that does not help, try using our script by following the instructions below.

---

This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If youre using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If youre using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.freshdirect.com/your_account/chef_table.jsp](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.freshdirect.com%2Fyour_account%2Fchef_table.jsp) ### Comment Username: @quaybj > This food ordering site has the option to get weekly discounts. The link to the promotion number and the discounted list does not work with adguard installed on my machines (MAC and PC). I have Chrome, Firefox, and Brave. That particular URL is blocked for all of them. I am using https://dns.adguard-dns.com/dns-query in my router DNS setting. Disabling adguard in the browsers does not work, maybe because it's the router DNS? The picture where the box is seen is from a machine where adguard is not installed at all. > > While making this query, I saw a lot of references to information on the settings for adguard, can you point me to the manual? I don't even know if I am using some of the settings or not, so I could not really answer the questions. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/X9bzzF4.png)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://reports-img.adguard.com/yimObJ0.png)

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Browser Extension

### AdGuard version

4.1.53

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome, Safari, Microsoft Edge

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://instagram.com

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. AdGuard breaks Instagram scrolling; ad removal makes the page jump back to a previous post and you can't scroll past it. Disabling AdGuard fixes the problem.

2. Can't show with screenshot, see attached screen recording

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7212610/226141501-1651b875-7792-45b4-8641-6dc4408308d1.mp4


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
>@AdamWr any other idea regarding looping issue?

As far as I can see, sponsored posts are hidden by this rule now:
```adblock
instagram.com#$?#main > div > section div[style*="flex-direction: column;"] > article > div:-abp-has(span:contains(/(Sponsored|Gesponsert|Sponsorlu|Sponsorowane|Ispoonsara godhameera|Geborg|Bersponsor|Ditaja|Disponsori|Giisponsoran|Sponzorovno|Sponsoreret|Publicidad|May Sponsor|Sponsorise|Oipytyvva|aukar Nayin|Sponzorirano|Uterwa inkunga|Sponsorizzato|Imedhaminiwa|Hirdets|Misy Mpiantoka|Gesponsord|Sponset|Patrocinado|Patrocinado|Sponsorizat|Sponzorovan|Sponsoroitu|Sponsrat|c ti tr|||| |||||  | ||||||||| | || |  |    | |  ||| || || )/)) { visibility: hidden !important; }
```
and I cannot reproduce looping issue, but there are empty spaces.

Something like this:
```adblock
instagram.com#$?#main > div > section div[style*="flex-direction: column;"] > article > div:has(span:contains(/(Sponsored|Gesponsert|Sponsorlu|Sponsorowane|Ispoonsara godhameera|Geborg|Bersponsor|Ditaja|Disponsori|Giisponsoran|Sponzorovno|Sponsoreret|Publicidad|May Sponsor|Sponsorise|Oipytyvva|aukar Nayin|Sponzorirano|Uterwa inkunga|Sponsorizzato|Imedhaminiwa|Hirdets|Misy Mpiantoka|Gesponsord|Sponset|Patrocinado|Patrocinado|Sponsorizat|Sponzorovan|Sponsoroitu|Sponsrat|c ti tr|||| |||||  | ||||||||| | || |  |    | |  ||| || || )/)) { height: 1px !important; visibility: hidden !important; }
```
works fine on my end (empty spaces are smaller and I didn't observe issue with looping).

issue.body:
New type of YouTube ads is blocked by our filters. If that does not help, try using our script by following the instructions below.

---

This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If youre using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If youre using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)
